From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2024 Indian Hindi-language film


Kaagaz 2Theatrical release posterDirected byV. K. PrakashWritten bySuman AnkurKhandelwal ShashankProduced bySashi Satish KaushikGanesh JainRatan JainNishant KaushikStarringAnupam KherDarshan KumaarSatish KaushikSmriti KalraAnang DesaiCinematographyAnu MoothedathEdited bySanjay VermaMusic bySharib-Toshi Srijan Vinay VaishnavProductioncompaniesSatish Kaushik EntertainmentVenus Worldwide EntertainmentDistributed byPen Marudhar EntertainmentRelease date
1 March 2024 (2024-03-01)
Running time119 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Kaagaz 2 is a 2024 Indian Hindi language courtroom drama film written and directed by V. K. Prakash.[1][2] 
Produced by Satish Kaushik Entertainments and Venus Worldwide Entertainment, It is a spiritual successor to 2021 film Kaagaz and stars Anupam Kher, Darshan Kumaar, Satish Kaushik, Smriti Kalra, Anang Desai, and Kiran Kumar in pivotal roles.[3]
Kaagaz 2 was released to positive reviews on March 1 2024.[4][5] It marks the posthumous film of Satish Kaushik following his death on 9 March 2023.


Premise[edit]
Kaagaz 2 is based on Article 15 of the Constitution of India, which permits the right to live, and prohibits discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or birthplace.[6][7]

Kapil Tilhari as Advocate Sunil Kukreti
Aniruddh Dave as Satty

Harry Josh

Arpit Mishra as Kamlesh Updadhyay
Kamlesh Upadhaya

Karan Razdan

Music[edit]
Kaagaz 2Soundtrack album by Sharib-ToshiReleased16 February 2024[8]Recorded2022GenreFeature film soundtrackLength16:49LanguageHindiLabelZee Music CompanyOfficial audioKaagaz 2 - Full Album on YouTube

The music of the film is composed by Sharib-Toshi. Lyrics are written by Rashmi Virag.[8]

^ "Kaagaz 2 Movie Review : A father's relentless pursuit for justice in the face of odds". The Times of India.

^ "Kaagaz 2 Review: Tale of a Helpless Father Who Seeks Justice for His Deceased Daughter". india.com.
